key_title: Key to the species of Velleia

source.author: Jeanes, J.A.
source.title: Goodeniaceae
source.in_title: Flora of Victoria. Vol. 4. Cornaceae to Asteraceae
source.citation: From: Jeanes, J.A. (1999). Goodeniaceae. In: Walsh, N.G.; Entwisle, T.J. (eds), Flora of Victoria. Vol. 4. Cornaceae to Asteraceae. Inkata Press, Melbourne.

leads.lead_text: Sepals 5; leaves variously toothed; corolla 10–22 mm long; seed conspicuously winged
Sepals 3; leaves almost entire; corolla 7–10 mm long; seed not winged; alps and subalps
Bracteoles free or nearly so; corolla wholly yellow or brownish near throat, spurred
Bracteoles fused; corolla often with purplish markings, not spurred; far north-west
Corolla-lobes more or less equal; indusium narrow-oblong; wing around seed 1–2 mm broad; plant glabrous or nearly so; far north-west and Dimboola area
Corolla-lobes unequal; indusium ovate; wing around seed to 1 mm broad; plant usually hairy; widespread
